comment: I feel like that part of the story is just like the intro hook for the dive into what the rest of what that movie is
there was one time I was grabbed without warning and it was when I was a teen
guy in my grade thought it’d be Hilarious if he swung an arm around me and gave me an aggressive side hug mid conversation with friends
i also dont want to spoil anything for anyone- but that time it happened he was in an extreme emotional state
i threw him off as fast as I could and sidled up closer to my group & wiggles into the less accessible middle - he and his friends laughed
somebody hugs me and I don’t know who they are better identify themselves and take a big steppy back before I get postal
https://youtu.be/C3m0BNvxjgA 1:20-ish he consciously considers not doing it.
im saying they are both teens in an impossible situation- you cant expect them to be completely rational people in a freaky friday situation
but is being a respectful guy with an understanding of how the girl whose body he swapped with would like to be treated during those freaky times too much to ask
Aye, had he NOT done it, the movie woulda been way more redeemable
it was a perfect chance at a comedically timed event
I’m going off information that I’ve got from the conversation so far
ok so you are missing a ton of context about an anime Kiwi
that kind of comedy sounds rapey
so provided these two swap bodies on occasion and find out maybe at one point to keep track of it and each other

but they lose their memories sometimes when it happens so they don’t know it’s not their body? ok, they play around, but knowingly one plays around fully aware he’s in her body and she doesn’t like it
they always lose most of their memories- they keep a bit but it always fades away
is this "woah are these boobs" groping or is it worse
it gets weird for the sake of weird

I think you got it mixed up my dude. The notes are to keep track of what each of them is doing in each other's bodies, they remember what they're doing to each other and the notes that they get left. The big memory loss bit is only the one that happens
After the disaster, that's why they make a big deal out of it at that moment.
if he’s aware of being in her body & that it’s not his & she doesn’t like him playing with himself when he’s in her body & he still does it? unacceptable
more or less that’s my point
they state that its like a dream and fades away- it just was happening so regularly - its why its such a big deal that he goes out to find her asap before it all leaves him
i agree Kiwi- but im saying hes not fully aware of that- to him being in her body is like a dream- he often doesnt remember it or it doesnt feel real- theres a mental disconnect
he tells her to stop spending all his money and messing with his love life - but she does it still anyways too- they are both doing this
they are also both kids- they arent super rational beings
yeah it’s meant to be like a goofy way two people connect through some weird... sci-fi circumstances
at least we don't have to worry about this in real life
stay in your own darn body
it's crowded enough in here as is
The first, maybe second time? That's goofy. The fourth time where you know it's wrong? That's just sexual assault.

with the only thing keeping it from qualifiying as a poncho that single thread at the very bottom hanging on by just a wish and a prayer

yeah the snow parts get pretty tedious
I had just gotten done setting up a giant network of ziplines to navigate them all. Was super proud of it.

I love playing support/logistics/healer in games, so helping/creating these giant social works was unreasonably cathartic to me, specially when you get the little popups notifying you that people are using them.
That game just pushed all the right buttons for me.
yeah just broody exploration, s’got depth to it
And the sci-fi bridge babit explanation (brain dead mother's premature babies) is so fucking out there, I love it.
That is some properly fucked science fantasy writing.
yeah, it’s foreign, but also kinda real with the whole mother/child emotional connection concept
Trapped between life and death to connect with the death stranding souls trapped the same way.

I mean some of it is loosely based on folklore stuff, kinda going back to the Japanese concepts where like untimely death and connection to the real world harbor emotions that bring about different kinds of ghosts
like think the grudge, like bad stuff leads to lingering manifestations
I can see that. Kojima loves that kinda stuff in his games.
so like the harnessing of it in a sci-fi sense turns it into this world-breaking mess
...and then just the original more personal story under all that
Y'all talking about the potential Kojima horror game :eyes:
but yeah it’s an extremely layered game that if you break it apart you can see where the inspirations came from, between SH, P.T. and like kojimas classic pol. thrillerness of like Metal Gear
That game is one I want to play
It's a game that isn't for everyone, but for the ones that enjoy it, it's freaking incredible.
